entry.title: Blog Design Copied - What Would You Do?
entry.content:
I posted a blog post yesterday, so the first thing I did when I woke up this morning was look at Google Analytics to for the most popular traffic sources. I found the following:

Never having heard of it before, I clicked on RubyConn. I clicked one of the first links on the page and saw this:

And here’s mine:

Wow! Full-on copy of my blog design. The blog title “build_something!” was even the title of a previous blog post Build Something.

The copied blog has a Github link so I clicked it. And sure enough…not even forked. Just local clone (not even forked), except most of the commits are my own.

My favorites commits are: remove my headshot (good thing!) and just hide my newsletter, but let’s still keep it.

Now, you’re probably asking yourself why I put it on Github in the first place. Honestly, it’s the perfect backup. And I never thought any one would copy the entire thing!

I spent several months with the help of a really talented UI designer to finalize my blog design. And in the end, was really happy with the outcome.

The whole thing is disappointing…sure I could try to ignore it, but when you spend so long working on something, it’s a bummer to see your work copied in 5 minutes without care.

So the question is…what would you do?
